Title:
Molecular Phylogeny of The Phylum Gastrotricha: New Data
Brings Together Molecules And Morphology
Abstract:
Gastrotricha is a specious phylum of microscopical animals
that holds two main orders, Chaetonotida and Macrodasyida. Gastrotrichs
are important members of the aquatic environments and important players
in the study of animal evolution. In spite of their ecological an
evolutionary importance, their internal relationships are not well
understood yet. We have produced new sequences for the 18S rDNA gene to
improve the taxon sampling for the gastrotrichs, not only in quantity
but also in quality (genera and families sampled). Our phylogeny
recovers the monophyly of the two main Gastrotricha clades, at
difference with recent studies with similar sampling, and displays a
great level of resemblance with morphology based analyses. However, our
topology is not able to solve the first branches of the macrodasyidans
or settle the position of the puzzling Neodasys, a controversial genus
classified as a chaetonotidan on morphological grounds, but placed
within macrodasyidans by the molecular studies. This analysis is the
more exhaustive molecular phylogeny of the phylum to date, significantly
increasing our knowledge of gastrotrich evolution.
